conclusion: The light source is initially at an angle from the left side, casting elongated shadows A, B, C, and D to the right of the objects.
The light source moves to the right and positions itself directly above the objects.
When the light source is directly above the objects, the shadows will be cast directly below the objects.
The shadows will no longer be elongated but will instead be shorter and more compact, directly beneath the objects.
Shadow A: Initially to the right of the cigarette box, it will now be directly below the cigarette box.
Shadow B: Initially to the right of the ball, it will now be directly below the ball.
Shadow C: Initially to the right of the dragon statue, it will now be directly below the dragon statue.
Shadow D: Initially to the right of the blue device, it will now be directly below the blue device.
The shadows will become smaller and more concentrated as they are cast directly below the objects, rather than being elongated to the side.
The shadows A, B, C, and D will move directly below their respective objects and become shorter when the light source is directly above the objects.
